titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert A. M. Stern Architects Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Laura Tatum, Larissa Woo, Susan Lane, Tim Reddy, and Suzanne Noruschat

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:15

did.unittitle: Robert A. M. Stern Architects records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of project files, drawings, images, and a small number of models of projects undertaken by Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP, as well as professional and personal correspondence, writings, lecture transcripts and notes, and television programming created by founding partner Robert A. M. Stern.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP, 2005-2007, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2014, and 2016.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records, except when noted as restricted, are open for research. Access restrictions are listed in both the Project Indexes and Project Records Inventories.
Requests for access to restricted records should be sent to the Manager of Archives and Records at Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright interests in the collection materials held by Robert A. M. Stern Architects have been transferred by the donor to Yale University. Nonetheless, the collection materials may contain content owned by third-party copyright holders. Determination of the copyright status of specific material may require extensive research and it is the responsibility of researchers and others intending to use the materials to secure permission of the appropriate copyright holder(s). All other uses not requiring permission of third-party copyright holders are permitted only in accordance with the restrictions and requirements specified herein.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert A. M. Stern Architects Records (MS 1859). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records were arranged by staff of Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP. Material was received in a number of chronological accessions consisting of either project records or professional and personal records. Records for all accessions are listed within this inventory, except for the first three accessions of Project Records (2006-M-010, 2007-M-094, and 2009-M-066), for which there are corresponding project indexes linked to this inventory.
Across accessions, there are multiple inter-related projects. Whenever possible "See Also" references have been included.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert A.M. Stern Architects, LLP, is a 220-person firm of architects, interior designers, and supporting staff. It was founded in 1977. The firm has established an international reputation as a leading design firm with wide experience in residential, commercial, and institutional work. The firm has earned international recognition, numerous awards and citations for design excellence, including National Honor Awards of the American Institute of Architects.

Robert A. M. Stern, founder and senior partner in the firm of Robert A.M. Stern Architects of New York City, is a Fellow of the American Institute of Architects and received the Medal of Honor in 1984 and the President's Award in 2001 from its New York chapter. In 2002 he received the President's Medal from the Architectural League of New York and in 2008 was the tenth recipient of the Vincent Scully Prize from the National Building Museum. Prior to becoming dean of the Yale School of Architecture in 1998, Stern was a professor of architecture and director of the Preservation program at the Graduate School of Architecture, Planning, and Preservation at Columbia University. He served from 1984 to 1988 as the first director of Columbia's Temple Hoyne Buell Center for the Study of American Architecture. Stern has lectured extensively in the United States and abroad on both historical and contemporary topics in architecture. He is the author of several books, including New Directions in American Architecture ; George Howe: Toward a Modern American Architecture ; and Modern Classicism . Stern's interest and experience in the development of New York City's architecture and urbanism can be seen in books he has coauthored: New York 1880 , New York 1900 , New York 1930 , New York 1960 , and New York 2000 . In 1981, Stern hosted Pride of Place: Building the American Dream , an eight-part, eight-hour documentary television series aired on PBS. In the fall of 2001, Stern lectured at Yale as the William Clyde DeVane Professor.
Sources: Firm information courtesy of Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP. Biographical information courtesy of Yale School of Architecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of project files, drawings, images, and a small number of models of projects undertaken by Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP, as well as professional and personal correspondence, writings, lecture transcripts and notes, and television programming created by founding partner Robert A. M. Stern.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For the first three accessions of Project Records (2006-M-010, 2007-M-094, and 2009-M-066), please consult the project indexes (linked to the finding aid), which provide a list of projects for each accession and indicate the box numbers in which project materials are located.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Requests for permission to publish should be sent to the Manager of Archives and Records at Robert A.M. Stern Architects, LLP.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For a list of projects and the boxes in which project materials for this accession are located, please consult theProject Index.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must receive permission to use restricted records. Requests for access to restricted records should be sent to the Manager of Archive Services at Robert A. M. Stern Architects, LLP. Project records with access restrictions are noted in the Project Index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records document the design work of the firm begun in 1990, 1991, and 1992. There are multiple inter-related projects during this time period and in some cases there is work related to projects from other time periods. Whenever possible "See Also" references have been included.
In general the records are made up of drawings, files and imagery. Models and artwork associated with these projects remain with RAMSA.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

did.unittitle: Vincent Scully: Yale University, interviews with Robert A. M. Stern

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of DVDs and transcripts of interviews with Robert A.M. Stern discussing Vincent Scully for a production by the Checkerboard Film Foundation. The finished project, Vincent Scully: An Art Historian Among Among Architects , is available on DVD.
